There isn't much here, I guess we are all busy. I'm currently semi-helping TeamKids Wednesday nights at church. Just wanted to update this blog, it's getting a little sad.

Today I attended a Lutheran service for the first time ever. Of course it was different than my CoC tradition but I was not totally lost thanks to the worship class I class I took. I felt it important to experience other worship services and not just talk or learn about them. I have to say I did like it. There was one part I did not expect but I liked it alot. There was a time in the service where we shared peace. Members exchanged "peace to you" or "Peace to God." And that brought a smile to me. There was something about saying and recieving peace. For me at least it allowed me to become a part of a whole and not just a separate piece. So, I say to you "Peace be with you."

I did it. I made myself watch John Kerry's whole speech. I did watch John Edwards speech but I was also switching it with Newlyweds so I didn't see the whole speech. Yes, it was a well delivered speech but I was not inspired. I guess because I was fed the usual of what politicians say to get your vote. It will be interesting to see Bush's speech and see if he responds to Kerry's criticism. I've decided to pay attention to the race this year because I am undecided, I don't even have party on my registration card anymore. So, I guess I'm in the swing vote category but I don't think it will make much difference here in Texas but I will vote none the less. Actually by being undecided I've stirred some controversy in my family, which I like to do every now and then. I have certain relatives who don't think you can be democrats and a Christian at the same time. (FYI I don't believe that and I am not a democrat) I wish I had something else to write on other than the DNC.

I feel so much relief now. I have completed all my assignments for my last class and I will graduate a week from Friday. In one sense I am so happy to be done but in another I am a bit sad about not being in school anymore. It has been such a transforming period of my life, actually it basically has been my life. Now I must step out of the academic world and step into the real world and I'm scared to death!

This morning I decided to go to a local community church. It is a large church with about 1,000 in attendance at the service. Once I arrived I entered the building and proceeded to walk inside the worship center when something I spotted made me immediately think, 'Why in God's name is there a 20ft heigh and 8ft wide model of DNA?!' I thought surely there is going to be some kind of explanation. And there was. It had something to do with there are certain characteristics of God that are part of his DNA. Okay, sure that's fine but why have a huge model of it, is that suppose to be the size of God's DNA? Then I kept wondering what would be going through a person's mind who had never been to church when they saw this, thing. I wonder if they thought this is what we worshiped? I don't know, maybe it's just me but when I walk into church I prefer not seeing DNA the size of a dinosaur.

I'm taking a course retroactive this summer and I was required to take a tour of a funeral home. So, this morning I did. I got to see everything except the prep room since their were bodies in there, so I understand why the director couldn't let me go in there. The director's wife gave me the tour and when we were in the chapel she told me something she found interesting was where she was from most services were done at the church but here in this areas most services are done at the funeral home. I too found this interesting. I've been to services both at a funeral home and a church. I guess it struck me is that why, if you have a home church, you would prefer the funeral home over the church. I think it would great if one was baptized, born again, and then given a service once your died in the same place. It's just a thought.

Today, I went to my home church (only b/c we were leaving to watch a baseball game) and presented before me was a pretty patriotic service. There were the church slash patriotic songs, they had a procession of the American Flag and the Christians Flag, and I'm pretty sure a patriotic sermon (but we missed that). Basically all that was missing were the fireworks. Don't get me wrong, I like being patriotic, but I don't like it at church. It is more of a personal thing, I like to keep that stuff out of worship service. To me it seems it should have been more sacred but I felt that line was crossed. I just don't believe God only blesses America, I know that is probably not the intention of the song but in my experience the way it is presented it is. So, yes I celebrate the fourth of July but not during the worship service becuase this time to celebrate, lament, kneel, and honor God not America. FYI, the game was horrible, we got stomped. Happy 4th of July.
